titleInfo.title: Portrait of Anna Naswitz of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 3 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope:''#460 JCRS Staff''. On back of print ''Anna Naswitz head nurse, JCRS, dynamic angel of mercy went to NY to see family of patients during annual convention in NY.'' Stamped on back of photograph: ''Denver, Colo., Jun 6 1939.''

mods.abstract: Anna Naswitz, head nurse of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver. Anna Naswitz was often considered the ''dynamic angel of mercy.''
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
